alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 17 at 9:29AM CST until February 17 at 12:25PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Pulaski County in central Arkansas... * Until 1225 PM CST. * At 929 AM CST, The public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in on I-30 between Arkansas River Bridge and I-630, public reported ponding of water and mud flow over the interstate due to construction. Moderate to Heavy Rain is expected to continue over the next 1 to 3 hours, likely causing additional Flash Flooding across the Little Rock metro area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Little Rock, North Little Rock, Sherwood, West Little Rock, Maumelle, Downtown Little Rock, Southwest Little Rock, Argenta, State Fairgrounds, Geyer Springs, Levy, Burns Park, Lakewood, Sweet Home, Camp Robinson, Protho Junction, McAlmont, Mabelvale, Otter Creek and Amboy. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
